metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12761 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A code injection issue was discovered in PyXDG before 0.26 via craftedPython code in a Category element of a Menu XML document in a .menu file.XDG_CONFIG_DIRS must be set up to trigger xdg.Menu.parse parsing within thedirectory containing this file. This is due to a lack of sanitization inxdg/Menu.py before an eval call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-xdg - 0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
python3-xdg - 0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pyxdg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1').
